title: Orange-Miso Glazed Black Cod with Sesame Rice

steps.text: Make the glaze by whisking together white miso, orange juice, mirin, soy sauce, honey, sesame oil, garlic, and ginger until smooth.
Pat the cod fillets dry and place them in a shallow dish. Spoon half the glaze over the fish, turning to coat. Reserve the remaining glaze for basting.
Marinate the fish in the refrigerator for 20-30 minutes to let flavors penetrate.
Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C). Line a baking sheet with foil and oil lightly to prevent sticking.
Place the fillets skin-side down on the prepared sheet. Roast for 8-10 minutes until the fish is opaque and flakes easily, basting once or twice with the reserved glaze during the last few minutes.
While the fish roasts, fluff the cooked short-grain rice and toss with a drizzle of sesame oil, toasted sesame seeds, and a pinch of salt.
Transfer rice to bowls, top with a glazed cod fillet, scatter sliced scallions and a little citrus zest over the top, and serve immediately.
